meanings.definition: Capable of being violated or transgressed.
meanings.sent1: The fragile lock showed its violableness when the thief easily broke it.
meanings.sent2: The violableness of the rules was evident when they were constantly ignored.
meanings.sent3: The violableness of the 'Do Not Enter' sign became a running joke among the students.
meanings.sent4: Her trust had a violableness that made her vulnerable to betrayal.
meanings.sent5: The violableness of the glass was apparent as it shattered with a gentle tap.

meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be violated or infringed upon.
meanings.sent1: The violableness of the contract allowed for loopholes to be exploited.
meanings.sent2: The violableness of privacy laws became a concern for many citizens.
meanings.sent3: The violableness of the 'No Trespassing' sign led to some unexpected visitors.
meanings.sent4: The violableness of trust in their relationship caused tension between them.
meanings.sent5: The violableness of the barrier was evident as people crossed it without hesitation.
